text: if you're looking for a really simple
dinner to make in your slow cooker why
not try beef stroganoff it couldn't be
easier and I am not exaggerating when I
say that to start off with all you need
to do is cut up an onion and so it
should be about two cups of onion so if
your onions kind of small use two of
them
I'm being super casual about the way
that I am cutting this up because it's
gonna break down in the slow cooker it's
cooking for six hours on low so you
really don't need to be too anal about
anything because it's gonna sort of
dissolve into the sauce so this can go
right into your slow cooker you could
start off by browning your meat it's up
Tang your onions and then put everything
in your slow cooker if you wanted to but
you can also just throw it all in there
and wait to see what happens because
it's gonna come out great this is two
pounds of beef chuck let's cut into
1-inch strips the beef should be cut
into half-inch wide strips that are
about three inches long and then one
pound of mushrooms that have been halved
to that add one and a half teaspoons of
salt the coarse salt if you're using
fine please use less and then a teaspoon
of black pepper then give it a toss just
to combine everything there's no
additional liquid needed cover it up
and cook it on low for eight hours or on
high for six hours it's done right so
what you want to do is thicken it in
this pan I have two tablespoons of water
and I'm gonna thicken my stew with
cornstarch so whisk your two tablespoons
of cornstarch into your cold water make
sure that the water is cold
you cannot put hot liquid like boiling

right away so you dissolve it in a
little bit of cold water first then you
can ladle about one cup of the juices
from your stew into that pot there's not
a ton a ton of liquid but there's a lot

right but as you can see it's not

take your liquid and pour it into your
cornstarch mixture and then just bring
it to the stove and bring it to a boil
and bringing it to a boil will thicken
the corn
start sure activate it it just needs to

then well your stew will still be watery
